alert.note: Alert for Baldwin (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued March 18 at 10:09AM CDT until March 18 at 11:00AM CDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: The National Weather Service in Mobile has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southwestern Baldwin County in southwestern Alabama... * Until 1100 AM CDT. * At 1008 AM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 9 miles east of Petit Bois Island, or 15 miles west of Dauphin Island, moving northeast at 60 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Fairhope, Foley, Orange Beach, Point Clear, Dauphin Island, Magnolia Springs, Bon Secour, Summerdale, Silverhill, Fort Morgan and Alabama Port. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until noon CDT for southwestern Alabama. A Tornado Watch also remains in effect until 200 PM CDT for southwestern Alabama...and northwestern Florida. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until noon CDT for southwestern Alabama. A Tornado Watch also remains in effect until 200 PM CDT for southwestern Alabama...and northwestern Florida.
